definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

sentences.english: Like the rain back in Canada that later turned to sleet.
sentences.chinese: 雨最终转化为雨夹雪，就像在加拿大那样。

sentences.english: The wind was whipping waves of sleet across the pond.
sentences.chinese: 寒风卷着雨夹雪，在池塘上肆虐。

sentences.english: Conditions were damp and foggy after morning sleet.
sentences.chinese: 早上的雨夹雪过后天气潮湿多雾。

sentences.english: When winter comes, we get sleet and frost.
sentences.chinese: 冬天来到时我们这儿会有雨夹雪和霜冻。

sentences.english: Chill December brings the sleet , Blazing fire and Christmas treat .
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的十二月带来雨夹雪，炉火熊熊，圣诞欢悦。

sentences.english: Parts of central Texas could see two to four inches of snow and sleet .
sentences.chinese: 德州许多地区则出现2到4英寸的降雪和雨夹雪。

sentences.english: We will live upon wedding-cake frosted with sleet.
sentences.chinese: 我们结婚后，将生活与雨夹雪磨砂蛋糕。

sentences.english: The snow and sleet made people stay away from the Bund and the cruises.
sentences.chinese: 雨夹雪使得外滩和游船上人烟稀少。
寒冷的十二月带来雨夹雪。

definition: Xiaoxue or Lesser Snow, 20th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 22nd November-6th December
